DMX-512 (Digital Multiplex) is a standardized protocol for controlling lighting and other devices in the entertainment industry, with applications in live performances, exhibitions, theatrical productions and architectural installations.
Introduced in 1986, DMX-512 uses a multi-drop bus topology to transmit digital data between devices over a single cable.
